result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.   rmm

Defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.

Pursuant to plea negotiations, the REPEATER enhancer is dismissed as to COUNTS 1 & 2.

AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AMENDED COUNT 2 - CONSECUTIVE:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 90 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

AMENDED COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 8 days time served.  Huber privileges.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.   Stayed.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim(s) without prior court/agent approval after consulting with the victim.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Jacob Robert Whetzel in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defendant did not appear.  A warrant has previously been issued due to Justice Point violations.  Court ordered the jury trial vacated.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  (Discharge Summary)  rmm
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Court in receipt of violation report from Justice Point.  Based upon failure to comply with the conditions of bail, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.  Final pretrial and jury trial dates remain.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (refusal) received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
